title: Welcome to Seattle
about: As the final project for the 201 level web developement course at Code Fellows, I worked with a team to create the "Welcome to Seattle" website. This tool is designed to help Seattle newcomers find the best neighborhood to meets thier needs.

title: App-a-thon
about:
As a founding Google Code Corps member, I helped pilot Google CS First at Boys & Girls Clubhouses and school sites across the Portland Metropolitan area. Part of my assignment was to plan and implement a hackathon event.

On the day of the event, staff drove 45 youth from Club sites across the city to the Northeast Portland Boys & Girls Club. I recruited and trained 14 skilled volunteers who led small teams through the process of brainstorming, wireframing, and programming an Android app. We served two hearty meals, held a project fair, and provided our youth with certificates and resources on continuing with computer science.
